situation: The lesson involved listening to audio and answering questions. The substitute forgot to use the hearing aid support system for J, affecting J’s ability to follow along.
action: Instead of finding an alternative, the substitute just told J to try harder to focus. No additional support was given, and J was left out of the activity.
effect: J felt isolated and frustrated, as he could not participate in an essential part of the lesson. This incident could lead to J feeling overlooked in future classes.
